profile.description:
Software Developer specialized in Backend development, focused on creating scalable solutions with Spring Boot and Microservices.
I have over 2 years of hands-on experience in the tech industry.

My previous background as an architect provides me with a structural and detail-oriented perspective for solving complex problems, working under pressure, and ensuring precise process execution.

Efficiency and quality are the core principles that drive my professional performance.

experiences.first-job-description:
As a Full Stack Developer, I focused on building practical and dynamic projects. I designed several games to sharpen my programming logic, a text encryptor to experiment with data security, and a movie catalog with full CRUD functionality.
These challenges helped me master data management and build user experiences from the ground up.
experiences.second-job-description:
As a Java Backend Developer, I specialize in building the logic and structure of functional systems. I have developed software integrating external APIs, as well as projects including bank account simulators and e-commerce platforms.
Additionally, I build REST APIs from the ground up, focusing on efficient data management and ensuring seamless, error-free performance.

hobbies.hobbie-description:
I'm passionate about diving into great stories, whether it's through video games, anime, books, or comics.

When I'm not exploring other worlds, I love creating my own by drawing or letting off some steam on the drums. For me, it's all about creativity, art, a good beat and a good structure.

projects.first-project-description:
ForoHub is a platform designed to create, manage, and participate in educational discussion forums. The project implements user registration, topics, and replies, along with full data CRUD operations. It handles data persistence in a database, accessible through API clients such as Insomnia.

- User Management: Authentication and authorization powered by JWT.
- Forum Management: Creation and visualization of topics and replies.
- Course Management: Association of courses with specific topics and categories.
- API Documentation: Automatically generated with Swagger (OpenAPI).
- Security: Implementation of roles and permissions using Spring Security.
projects.second-project-description:
With this application, you will be able to perform book searches by consuming the Gutendex API.
You have several search modes available, such as:

- Search books by title.
- List registered books.
- List registered authors.
- List authors alive in a specific year.
- List books by language.
projects.third-project-description:
With this application, you will be able to create secret messages. It features a challenging 'encryption key' logic.
It includes message encryption and decryption functionalities.
projects.fourth-project-description:
With this application, you will be able to perform currency conversions between different currencies.

Available currencies
US Dollar (USD)
Euro (EUR)
British Pound (GBP)
Japanese Yen (JPY)
Canadian Dollar (CAD)
Colombian Peso (COP)
Chilean Peso (CLP)
Mexican Peso (MXN)
Brazilian Real (BRL)
Argentine Peso (ARS)
projects.fifth-project-description:
This project is a Java-based console application that simulates the core functionality of an online store. The system allows users to log in, manage a virtual wallet, browse available products, handle a shopping cart, and complete purchases with real-time balance validation and stock control.

The project was designed prioritizing logical flow clarity and the separation of concerns between classes, leaving room for future enhancements such as managing multiple quantities per product, among others.
